page.title: 19A WALK ON THE MOORS
page.content: Machines used to come along and cut the peat and turn it over. The peat was left there to dry and then brought back to the mill on trains. When we picked some peat it was very clean and it broke into pieces very quickly. We walked a bit further and saw some train lines that led up to Swinefleet near Goole. The train line is not used on this part of the moors any-more. The peat had been removed from this area to a depth of between 4-6ft. We walked where there had been a railway which took the peat to the mill for processing. We also saw some Cotton grass, Rhodedendrons, Marguerites and Birdsfoot Trefoil. On the way back we got lost, but walked a bit farther and got off the moors safely.
